characters: PARKING LOT AT AN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
A LEGEND APPEARS OVER THE IMAGE OF KATE RUNNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: KATE HANNAH -- late-20s, pretty and wholesome a oh yeah, piss drunk. She stands on a tiny

dialogues.speaker: KARAOKE STAGE
dialogues.text: in the far corner of a half-empty dive bar. Kate holds a MICROPHONE and dances as she SINGS a bad kar version of "SONG TO BE DETERMINED." What Kate lacks in ta she more than makes up for with charm and enthusiasm. At a table near the stage is -- -- CHARLIE HANNAH: Kate's husband, late-20's, scruffy but handsome, also pretty damn drunk. He enthusiastically cla and points to Kate, making up a cheering section along wi -- OWEN HANNAH -- Charlie's younger brother, early-20's - who sings along with -- -- the small but energetic CROWD. Kate begins to ramble between verses -- and gleefully poi to Charlie and Owen. For the moment, this drunk girl is t Queen of Karaoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate finishes the song and drunkenly tumbles off the stag join Charlie and Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was so good, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. You sing like an angel -- a drunk angel. Owen and Kate LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were writing about my performance for your blog, what would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say that, uh...my wife is the sexiest, most amazing woman alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be such a shitty article -- nobody would read it. Kate and Charlie laugh and kiss -- and then Kate glances Owen and makes a puppy dog face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Owen) Aw...we need to find you a lady, Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- I've been trying to flirt with the bartender, but...I can't tell. Owen motions to the -- -- FEMALE BARTENDER, early 20's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hot! What can't you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks like she could kick my ass. No way would she go for a guy like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being a little girl -- just go talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly shy) I don't know...forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not going to take "no" for an answer) I'll take point -- follow me. Kate stumbles to the bar. Charlie and Owen follow. Kate p her arms around Owen and gets the attention of the barten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to buy a gimlet for me and a double-shot of whiskey for my brother-in-law `cause he's had a hard week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Kay. The bartender quickly pours the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- don't you wanna know what happened to him? The bartender rolls her eyes and checks around the bar to if there are other customers. It's pretty dead -- so she listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unenthused) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just got back from England -- because he went there for a girl! A preppy, bitchy girl. Diane Court...that was her name. He loved her so much that he went with her because she had a fellowship or something. He gave up being a kickboxer. A kickboxer!                               * (sad) And she dumped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender sizes up Owen. The trio waits with anticipa to hear her response, which is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Owen) You kickbox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught in the headlights) Yeah. And...that's all Owen's got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in) And he teaches kids at the kickboxing studio. Oh, they're so cute! The bartender glances back to Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) A lot of `em don't have parents -- so...it's kinda more than just a teacher/student thing. (beat) I know it sounds silly, but I feel responsible for them -- like... (emotional) ...I could be their parent. Kate slides down the bar to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) I think I got him laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems totally game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure she just didn't want to get into your pants? Kate rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm done for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Owen wanders over, dejected.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's seen "Say Anything."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, well...what're you gonna do, huh? (beat) Wanna drive us home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- he needs to keep working it!         * You guys stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to watch my brother not score. I want to go to bed with you and... (whispered into Kate's ear) ...you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be home when you get there. We can "you know" then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlie) Yeah, man -- you don't have a job to wake up for in the morning or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writing is a job! Not having to report to an office only makes work harder. (to Kate) Baby, you drank a lot. I think Owen should take us home -- you're too drunk to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's Owen. (suddenly focused) I'm not that drunk. Besides, you know I focus when I drive -- it sobers me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate kisses Charlie and hugs Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, baby. I'll be waiting for you in a nice warm bed. You have exactly one mission: get your brother laid -- and don't talk to any other women. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like two missions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Owen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It kinda sounded like two, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It did. Kate grins and slowly backs away towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GoodbyeIloveyouboth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stumbles out of the bar and hears a GROAN. She glanc over and sees: A drunk woman -- FREDA, 30s -- sitting on the curb. She M again. Kate glances around the parking lot. Nobody else but her Freda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm not really okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bitch sister just took off and left me here so she could hook up with some asshole. Now what am I supposed to do? Huh? I don't have a car here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll give me a ride? Oh my god! Thank you! Freda gets up quickly -- and almost falls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna say "call you a cab," `cause, you know -- I don't even know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not far. Please? Pretty please...? Kate looks dismayed. Not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car passes through Chinatown on its way downtown. Kate drives with Freda in the passenger seat. Freda glanc down at the floor and notices a FLASK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you shouldn't drink and drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding. Can I have a sip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's speechless. FREDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really thirsty. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, uh...whiskey. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah, it's whiskey! I love whiskey. You're the real thing, huh? A hardcore drinking bitch like me! Freda takes a swig from Kate's flask. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. No. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I smoke in your car? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly annoyed) Okay, fine -- go ahead. Can you just roll down the window? FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- I'm not uncivilized. Freda takes out a -- -- CRACK PIPE and lights it, deeply inhaling crack smoke. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: WHOA
dialogues.text: Kate immediately pulls the car over. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I thought you meant. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a hit? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I...is that pot? FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though it's a ridiculous question) Of course not! What do I look like? A stoner? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) It's crack. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! No...no thank you. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- it's good crack. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, um...I've never smoked crack. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Really? This stuff is the truth -- and it'll sober you up. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...I think you should go. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting out in the middle of nowhere. Do you know what could happen to me all alone out here at                     * night? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- people might offer you crack? FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously? It's not a big deal -- just take a little hit. Kate and Freda stare at each other. A stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said no. FREDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hit won't hurt you. It'll sober you up. Kate glances at the pipe, which Freda wiggles in front of her. FREDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched cartoon voice) Smoke me! Kate LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One puff. Then we are both going home. Freda nods. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Freda puts the pipe into Kate's lips and lights it. Kate sucks in crack smoke. Her eyelids flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got money, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near some TENTS, CARDBOARD BOXES, and SHOPPING CARTS -- -- Kate smokes crack with FREDA and TWO OLDER MEN. They p around TWO PIPES.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Freda is passed out on a SLEEPING BAG on the sidewalk. Kate is animatedly telling a story to the two guys -- who still smoking crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mile-a-minute fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'cause I feel like I understand what it's like to be homeless, ya know? I mean, if you didn't know me, if we hadn't connected tonight, you might think: "There's some upper-middle-class, NPR listening, self-congratulatory, insulated, lazy liberal bitch. Probably never had to worry about anything." But that's not true at all! I grew up poor, man. Single mother. McDonald's used to have one day a week where they sold 29 cent hamburgers, and another day where they had 39 cent cheeseburgers. My mom and me would go there and she'd get twenty burgers -- that was the limit, probably set up for folks just like us -- and then she'd put `em in the freezer and we'd microwave `em for dinner throughout the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kinda overweight until high school, to be perfectly honest. Eating used to be my thing. When I started drinking, though, I kinda stopped eating so much. (back on track)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But anyway, the point is: You and me, we're not so different. The two guys aren't paying much attention to Kate. They'r more concerned with their crack pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is asleep on the curb. She looks awful. Suddenly, Ka eyes widen. She looks around at her surroundings, confuse then jumps to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate runs through the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK along with Kate as she dashes past various buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stare down a long, empty street, the downtown SKYSCRAP towering in the distance. From out of nowhere -- -- Kate appears at the end of the street and sprints towa the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate drives -- a paranoid expression on her face and her hands tightly gripping the steering wheel. She glances do at -- -- her CELL PHONE in the passenger seat. 21 missed calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes various sites on her way from downtown to High Park. 8   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - MORNING Kate slowly pulls into the driveway of a small, cute hous 9   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM/HALLWAY

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Kate walks into the kitchen to find -- -- Charlie asleep at the kitchen table. CELL PHONE next t his head. Empty BEER BOTTLES litter the table. Kate tip-toes across the kitchen. Charlie quickly jerks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh...it's okay, baby. Go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? I came home and you were gone and I waited and waited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried. I kept calling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ended up... Charlie SNIFFS Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell funny. What do you smell like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell asleep in my car. Near the bar. I was too drunk to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why didn't you come back or call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I'm not. I worry, baby. I love you -- and you know how you get sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. But I'm home. It's over. I gotta get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be worried about you all the time. Kate rubs Charlie's hair and kisses his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry so much. I'm fine. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- let me get you to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up now -- how `bout I make us bacon and egg sandwiches? Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows he's got her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic words. 10   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BATHROOM - MORNING Kate takes a shower -- while she drinks a BEER. Gets dressed. Puts on make-up. 11   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - KITCHEN - MORNING Kate walks into the kitchen, ready to go. Charlie is at t stove, cooking bacon and eggs. He hands Kate a MUG OF COF and gestures to the table -- where there's a CHECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check for your mom's on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, baby. Kate takes a sip of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does the coffee taste so much better when you make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I make it with love -- and bacon. Kate LAUGHS and kisses Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate takes a right on a STREET and then pulls into the

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT AT AN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
dialogues.text: She's about to get out, but then notices... ...the FLASK on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kate chugs what's left in the flask.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: MR. DAVIES -- the assistant principal, early-40's, slight nerdy but not bad looking, watches -- -- Kate drink in her car. CHILDREN pass by in the distance. Mr. Davies takes a beat, but instead of saying anything h walks away through the parking lot. Kate doesn't notice she's been seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands next to a CHALKBOARD in front of a class of T GRADERS. She's really animated -- doing her "game show hostess" schtick. On the chalkboard are the letters: "AN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if I add a "C," what word do I have? A STUDENT raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Hillary?                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct! Can. You've won an all-expenses paid trip to the blackboard, Hillary!                                  * Hillary hesitates. She looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...there's a washer-dryer combo in it for you. Hillary shuffles up to the board and writes "CAN."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great job, Hillary -- let's give                      * her a round of applause! The class APPLAUDS. Hillary smiles and goes back to her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can anyone use "can" in a sentence? A student -- ANGELA -- raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hurry up in there -- I gotta use the can!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students GIGGLE. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly moving on) Wonderful, Angela. You get a Camaro with flames painted on the hood. The students CHEER. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- (to the class) -- what's another word I could make by adding a letter to "an"? Nobody raises their hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Finally, a student in the back -- RAMON -- raises his han KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- Ramon?

dialogues.speaker: P.
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P...okay, what word would that make if I added a "P"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...pan? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan! That's right. Ramon Martinez...COME ON DOWN! Ramon walks up and begins to write "PAN." KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Just look at that excellent penman -- Kate stops suddenly and raises her hand to her mouth. She quickly runs behind her desk, leans over, and discretely -- VOMITS on the floor! Ramon -- who's just inches from the pool of vomit -- look horrified. Kate glances up from behind her desk to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the kids all make grossed-out faces and say things lik

dialogues.speaker: SHRIMP
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, Kate quickly gets TISSUES from her desk and begins cleaning up the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry you had to see that. HILLARY stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hannah -- are you pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mommy threw up when she was pregnant with my little sister. Are you pregnant? Some of the kids begin WHISPERING (saying things like "Oo "She's gonna have a baby.").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? Kate seems flustered and says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits across a desk from -- -- PRINCIPAL BARNES: female, early 50's, stern, scattered and clearly a softy at heart, she wears a pair of GLASSES around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vice Principal Davies will be looking after your students for the rest of the day -- so you don't need to worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's really good to know. I'll have to thank him. (beat) I just feel awful for getting sick in front of my students. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please -- they're troopers. I'm sure they've seen plenty worse. (beat) So -- how long have you been pregnant? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...it's the first trimester. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's very exciting. You must be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Uh-huh. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask a...personal question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it... (beat) ...going for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pregnancy, I mean. Kate's not sure how to respond. PRINCIPAL BARNES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having kids wasn't in the cards for me. I came close, but... Principal Barnes drifts off into thought for a moment, th catches herself and quickly shifts gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL BARNES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I mean, it's like I've got a couple hundred kids here -- (forces a laugh) -- but...I don't fool myself. It's not the same. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers her reply) Well...it's hard to explain. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't call it a burden, but -- PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a responsibility. Beat. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Exactly. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) You're so lucky. (beat) Can I...touch it? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I don't...okay -- but it sleeps a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like...a lot. Principal Barnes gets up and kneels next to Kate. She pla her hand on Kate's belly and closes her eyes. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Hello in there. Can you hear me? You're a tiny miracle. Did you know that? A miracle. Principal Barnes looks up at Kate and smiles -- with tear her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks down the hall and comes to the door of her classroom. Through the glass she sees -- -- Mr. Davies. He notices Kate and smiles (the concerned smile you give someone right after they've publicly embarrassed themselves). Kate mouths the words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (silent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. -- and gestures "come here." Mr. Davies gestures   to the class that he'll be right ba before he walks out   to talk to Kate. He's got a slightl nervous demeanor --   somewhere between "I never became comfortable talking   to women" and Asperger's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything, um...okay, Mrs. Hannah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...I'm really embarrassed -- but I feel a lot better. And I just wanted to say thank you. Mr. Davies glances down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I'm not a fool. (whispered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you were drinking this morning. Kate looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinking when you're pregnant is really dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that! Oh, God, I... (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...listen -- I'm not actually pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just really hung over. The kids started asking me questions after I vomited and I panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's...not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I...please don't say anything. Mr. Davies looks torn, unsure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...go home. Get some sleep. Before Kate can say a word, Mr. Davies heads back into th classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate has her face fully in the sink while water runs over and -- -- TWO LITTLE GIRLS curiously watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie play POOL while splitting a PITCHER OF B It's a bit early to be drinking, but hey -- why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had such a crappy morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. I spent like three hours at the post office trying to buy stamps and stuff. Kate takes a long sip of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told my class I was pregnant. Charlie looks up at Kate with a beaming smile. He leans o and grabs her hand. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited and sort of confused) Oh, baby, that's -- KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. Pregnant. So don't worry. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deflated) Oh. (beat) `Cause it would be great news -- if it was true. (beat) `Course then I'd have to drink your beer... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was a lie. I just lied to my class. After barfing in front of them. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringes) Ooh... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what they said. (long beat) Listen...I can't do this anymore. A look of complete terror and confusion passes over Charl face. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I think I might...drink too much. Charlie LAUGHS. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That. Yeah...you kinda do. Charlie swigs his beer.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know I do -- I'm a fucking mess...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Baby -- that's not true. You're beautiful. And brilliant. And I love you. I wouldn't be married to a "mess."

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I left work after puking in front           * of little kids. And...now I'm               * drinking in the middle of the day.          *

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Well, those things happen sometimes. (beat) I mean, they shouldn't happen all the time, but...it's the price of, uh, truly living life.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Isn't that like a slogan for some kind of beer or toothpaste or something...?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. And it's true -- you and me, we're not just some boring couple in the suburbs who don't sleep with each other and have nothing to talk about except whatever TV show they're currently into. (beat) We, like...still know how to party.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah... (beat) ...I think I need to slow down. (beat) And I might need help.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know, but...I might need more help.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like a therapist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- I just get stupid when I'm drunk, and I'm drunk a lot. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just like to have a good time. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... (beat) ...you've gotta promise not to tell this to anyone. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curious) I promise. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That includes Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, last night I kinda, um... (hushed) ...smoked some crack.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Some bar patrons glance at Kate and Charlie. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I left the bar, I, uh, picked up this drunk girl and...I don't really remember what came next, but I ended up smoking crack with her. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Uh...how's that even happen? (beat) You give someone a ride and she rewards you with crack?! KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...she seemed desperate. She really needed a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtown. I think she maybe lives in...a tent? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...she might be homeless. Or a prostitute. Or just some lost sorority girl. (thinks about it) To be honest, I'm not sure... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Oh, my god...you smoked crack with some random stranger? Did you...share a pipe? Kate doesn't answer. She doesn't need to. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ughhh... (beat) Just playing Devil's advocate, but maybe it's the crack-smoking you need help with and not the drinking. Kate gives Charlie a dirty look. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drinking led to the crack- smoking. The drinking leads to everything stupid I do. (beat) I mean...can you even remember the last time we had sober sex? Charlie begins to answer, but then...goes blank. He tries remember. And can't. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll chill out with the booze for a while. We can just be wine-with-                   * dinner people. (beat) How's that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie joyfully ride BICYCLES home from the bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go to, uh... one of those meetings. They have `em over there. Charlie gestures to a BUILDING (could be a church or different type of building where AA meets). Kate LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when I was shit-faced and took that Q & A pamphlet from there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! And we answered "yes" to like every question and at the end it was like, "If you answered `yes' to any of these you're an alcoholic!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (nostalgic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that was fun, wasn't it? Kate smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Charlie gestures to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- look out for that crack! Kate looks down but sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What crack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry -- I thought there was a crack there... (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you must have smoked it last night. Kate rolls her eyes -- and then jokingly swerves towards Charlie, trying to knock him over. He LAUGHS and speeds a Kate chases after him. 20   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - LATE While an old 70's R & B song plays on a RECORD PLAYER is next to STACKS AND STACKS OF RECORDS -- -- Kate and Charlie drunkenly slow dance, drink WINE, and LAUGH at an AA PAMPHLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Have you missed days of work or school because of drinking?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Do you envy people who can drink without getting into trouble?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Envy isn't exactly the right word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Do you have `blackouts'?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but who doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Has your drinking caused trouble at home?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! We're great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Definitely. But we still had a lot of "yes" answers. (refers to pamphlet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep...we still qualify as drunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'm serious! I'm gonna go. What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight. Kate gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't believe her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... Kate takes a big sip of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quite serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me: going. Charlie LAUGHS -- he doesn't buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been boozing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? You should come too! Charlie LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. You can't go to AA wasted. It's like a rule or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Watch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AA meeting is in progress. An OLDER WOMAN stands at the podium sharing her story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is filled with -- -- different groups of PEOPLE, all of whom sit with their "own group," like a high school lunch room -- but the peo are adults. There are distinct groups of --

dialogues.speaker: -- "BUSINESSMEN" --
dialogues.text: -- and "HIPSTERS." As Kate -- who's slightly confused -- enters the building hip looking man -- DONOVAN, 30's -- stops her, extending hand. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Hey, I'm Donovan. Welcome. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Donovan -- I'm Kate! Donovan "shushes" Kate. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be a newcomer, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what? DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Um, I'm not really allowed to talk to new chicks, but there are lots of women here who can help you out. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Okay. (beat) Do I just sit wherever? DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting already started so just try to find a spot anywhere. Kate drunkenly stumbles to the back of the room, saying things like "sorry" and "I like that jacket" as she takes seat next to two very CLEAN CUT WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the woman at the podium continues to speak, the women to Kate quietly try to welcome her. LILY                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you new? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To this? Yeah. Why's everyone whispering? SHANA                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard, huh? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. LILY                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be fine. You're home. Kate doesn't respond -- just looks around with the fear anyone would have if they felt they had just accidentally joined Jim Jones' church.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The room is COMPLETELY FULL -- with over ONE-HUNDRED PEOP The tattooed man stands at the podium. TATTOO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to embarrass anyone, but so that we may get to know you better - - is there anybody here in their first thirty days of recovery? Several PEOPLE scattered throughout the room stand up and introduce themselves as alcoholics. Kate stands up. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Kate. I...I'm...I guess I'm a little drunk right now. People burst into LAUGHTER. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to talk about my childhood or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TATTOO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (painfully polite) You know, Kate, we actually ask that you don't share if you've had                  * a drink or any mind-altering substance in the past 24 hours. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not listening) I can -- I kinda hate my dad and don't talk to him. And my mom...oh, man...I don't even know where to start. She's, like, stuck in the 80's and kind of a metalhead. Her last boyfriend called himself a drummer but really just gave drum lessons to little kids and -- TATTOO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to shut Kate up) Welcome, Kate. (forces a smile) It gets better. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not picking up the hint) I like drinking is the thing. I mean, I don't want to say you guys are wrong or anything... Kate nervously LAUGHS. Some of the PEOPLE in the crowd look embarrassed for Kate TATTOO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you -- we're all here to help. We do have to move on, though. The woman next to Kate gets her to sit back down. LILY                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, sweetie -- there'll be plenty of time to tell your story. A young woman -- AMBER, 22 -- approaches the podium. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm Amber, alcoholic. I can't really believe that it's been five years. I mean, my life was a mess back then. Now I'm back in school, I have an amazing man, I love my parents -- it's crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (way too loud) How old is that girl?! Can she even go to bars? (to Amber) How old are you, Amber? SHANA                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be respectful. Kate seems surprised at being chastised. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gaining intensity) Um...okay? It's because I did the work. I got down on my knees and prayed every night! I went to a meeting everyday! KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't easy, but I've gotta say, I owe everything to AA. Well, AA -- and God, of course! The whole room APPLAUDS.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Everyone is standing, holding hands, and saying the SEREN PRAYER. EVERYONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change -- courage to change the things I can - - and wisdom to know the difference. KATE

dialogues.speaker: AMEN
dialogues.text: Everyone turns and looks at Kate. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Okay...I think I'm good. Kate quickly leaves the meeting as clumsily as she arrive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT Kate chugs frozen Margarita straight from a PITCHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for that. Kate and Charlie stand in their backyard, which is criss- crossed by WHITE CHRISTMAS LIGHTS and has some old LAWN FURNITURE. They drunkenly play CROQUET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it a bunch of old biker guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was...I don't know. Enthusiastic people. A lot of really ENTHUSIASTIC PEOPLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuck -- I hate enthusiasm. I'm sorry it wasn't cool. Charlie thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really imagine never drinking. I guess I don't have to, though -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you're the one with the problem. Kate nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I love you. I don't want you to have to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to drink. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just really like to drink.                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good -- `cause you're my favorite person to drink with in the whole damn world. Charlie leans in to kiss Kate. They make out for a moment and then Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...BITES Charlie's lip. Charlie pulls back, shocked. Kate grins mischievously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no you didn't! Charlie lunges at Kate, who dodges him and LAUGHS. Charli dives and playfully tackles Kate. They begin to wrestle i the grass -- it's cute and loving but perhaps a little to intense. 23   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Kate and Charlie are making out on the bed. Kate starts t unbutton Charlie's shirt. As it turns out, Charlie's extremely drunk (and it's apparent in his movements and voice).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to have some sex? Kate removes Charlie's pants and takes off her clothing. climbs on top of him and -- -- they start having sloppy, drunk sex. After a few beats, Kate notices that Charlie isn't moving She looks down to discover that -- -- he's passed out. Kate pauses for a moment...then continues to ride her unconscious husband. 24   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Kate drinks what's left in the TEQUILA BOTTLE as she drunkenly searches the fridge, counter, and cupboard for booze. She finds a few sips here and there at the bottom couple BEER BOTTLES -- but she seems frustrated that ther isn't more alcohol in the house.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kate puts on her slippers, robe and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate drunkenly rides a BICYCLE down the street (still in robe and slippers).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate tries to open the LOCKED glass fridge where the BEER kept. After several attempts, she gives up and grabs TWO BOTTLES OF WINE from a shelf. Kate sets the bottles on the counter. The CLERK -- a tired looking man in his 30's -- looks at with pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't sell you this, Kate. An ELDERLY MAN -- shopping for frozen food -- glances ove Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You can't tell I'm 21? Come on -- I'm in here all the time. You know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do, Kate. And I know you're old enough -- but it's too late. The clerk holds up his WATCH (which reads 2:45).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- we can just pretend it's before two... Kate reaches down and tries to rewind the clerk's watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a little wine. I'm not driving or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Sorry. Kate gives him a big, flirty smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, dude -- I'll let you have a sip if you want. Kate tries to do a "sexy" dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the law. I can't sell alcohol after 2 a.m. You know that. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you give it to me, then? That wouldn't hurt anything. A gift -- because we're friends. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could lose my job. Kate doesn't have anything to say back -- so she glances the Elderly Man in the frozen food section. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the elderly man; meant to be a whisper, but way too loud) You distract him, okay?! The elderly man puts up his hands, not wanting any part o it. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- why don't you get a bottle of water or a coffee or something instead? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water or coffee? Fuck you. What -- just cause I won't suck your dick? CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (had enough) Oh my god. Okay, enough -- you gotta go. Kate doesn't budge. CLERK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Kate. You should go. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Fuck you! Fuck you! Kate is hysterical and her eyes are starting to fill with tears. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit! (beat) I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate runs down the aisle and tries to open the bathroom d - but it's locked. She hides from view, and then squats d and begins to pull up her robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to! Sometimes I just have to pee really, really bad.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...can't we drink together? The clerk clearly isn't going to budge. Kate nods, resign and then... ...grabs a BOTTLE OF WINE and dashes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is passed out on the concrete bank of the Los Angele River. The empty bottle of (screw top) wine is next to he Kate's bicycle lays in some weeds nearby. A bird SQUAWKS. Kate slowly wakes up, confused, and in a zombie-like stat she gets up and trudges home, wheeling along her bike. 28   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - MORNING Kate is awakened by the deafeningly loud ALARM CLOCK and sound of a news radio ANNOUNCER. She looks at the clock a realizes that -- -- it's 7:30. She jumps out of bed in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! Kate pauses when she realizes her back is wet. She looks at the bed, which is --

dialogues.speaker: -- COMPLETELY SOAKED.
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbled) Not again. Half-asleep, Charlie rolls over onto the pee-soaked part the bed. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back to bed, baby. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to work. You snoozed my alarm again. I'm gonna be late. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you peed on me so I guess                     * we're even.                                         * KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a weak bladder. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I can't go to work like this. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work from our kitchen. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but changing the sheets is my real job. (beat) Hey -- where were you last night? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up at like 4 a.m. and you were gone. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would I go at 4 a.m. alone? You must've been dreaming. Kate then glances down and notices -- -- that HER FEET ARE COVERED IN DIRT AND GRASS. She pauses, slightly alarmed, but continues getting ready

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's on her knees, puking into a toilet.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kate exits the stall to find -- -- Principal Barnes standing by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only imagine the chemistry experiment that's going on -- Barnes points at Kate's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits on a SMALL CHAIR reading a CHILDREN'S BOOK to h class -- -- who're sitting Indian style in a semi-circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna have a boy or a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until summertime. You guys will be on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a boy what will you name him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...Woodrow Wilson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a name for a man -- not a baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children LAUGH. Kate LAUGHS too -- but looks a little freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate eats her PACKED LUNCH with Mr. Davies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for covering for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't promise to cover for you every time you get pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I genuinely hope not. Look -- I didn't tell Barnes, but if anything like this happens again I'll have to. Mr. Davies smiles -- a sweet, genuine smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... (not sure what to say)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...David? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave. Kate tries to hold back a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -- Dave Davies...yup...hah- hah. Anyway, uh, is everything okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I puked in front of my class and then told everyone I'm pregnant. That's not really okay, huh? MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think so. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to AA last night. MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly uncomfortable) Oh, yeah? What'd you think of it? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was awful. I kept getting shushed. MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't normally tell people I work with this... but -- Mr. Davies takes a COIN that says "Nine Years" out of his pocket and shows it to Kate. MR. DAVIES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm a bit of an expert when it comes to these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) You? MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me. I've lived a strange one.                    * I'm nine years sober, AA and NA. (beat) I used to drink cocaine. (off Kate's shocked expression) It's really cheap in the Philippines. Mr. Davies takes a beat to think about what he's saying. MR. DAVIES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Kate. I know meetings can be weird. Especially at first, but if you want to...you never need to feel like you have to...but the ones I go to are pretty small. Nice little groups. (beat) I'd be happy to take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that would be good...I don't know. MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pressure, okay. That shit saved my life, though. Principal Barnes walks in. MR. DAVIES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (switching gears) Well, I'm scheduled to observe Ms. Carol's art class. They're making macaroni art, so...I'm pretty stoked. Mr. Davies gets up to leave -- discretely winking at Kate he exits. Principal Barnes watches Mr. Davies leave, a puzzled expression on her face. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Mrs. Hannah -- I've got something for you... Principal Barnes opens the MINI FRIDGE to reveal a huge j of ORANGE JUICE. PRINCIPAL BARNES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folic Acid! You need it now like never before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Thanks. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet your mother is over the moon, huh? Probably planning you a baby shower...? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well...she and I aren't that close. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Well, listen -- any motherly thing you need -- I'm                       * here, okay? Barnes hands Kate a large glass of juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now drink up -- that baby in there's thirsty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (takes a sip of orange juice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...you're kinda the only person at school -- besides Mr. Davies -- who knows I'm pregnant. Could you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lips are -- Principal Barnes mimes "zipping" her lips. 32   EXT./INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM/K

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks in the front door to see    -- -- Charlie working on his computer. A BEER next to him. A old record PLAYS on the record player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy. Kate collapses on the couch next to Charlie and kisses hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your day? And what's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh -- alright. Couldn't find oatmeal so I made ketchup soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! You need to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It's tasty. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...I'm going to see that band                      * from Iceland with the triplets play                  * tonight. Want to come with me and Owen to check it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that sounds fun, but... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- Owen can't pick up girls without you. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...this guy I work with -- Mr. Davies -- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice Principal? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- turns out he's sober and invited me to a meeting. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Wow, that's...uh, cool. Charlie goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- I just...I didn't think you really loved the meeting you went to yesterday. In fact, it sounded like you hated it. So I'm kinda surprised you're going back. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...this is a smaller meeting. It might be different. I dunno -- I think I want to give it a fair shot. Charlie nods. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides -- I was hammered last night. (beat) Go on and have fun out drinking with Owen tonight. Seriously. I'm just gonna, you know, try something         * different... Charlie pulls Kate close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here for you, okay? Even though I drink -- I could slow down if you need me to. (forces a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate approaches a small church. Mr. Davies waits outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Davies walks Kate into a medium sized room where -- -- about TEN PEOPLE are getting coffee, talking, and sett CHAIRS IN A CIRCLE. Kate looks around the room, scoping out the people, who'r very different from the crowd at the previous night's mee

-- several BLUE COLLAR MEN -- -- JENNY: 40-ish, with dark hair and a confident, sort of tough demeanor -- -- a few OLDER PEOPLE, and a YOUNG COUPLE. Mr. Davies directs Kate over to a table with COFFEE and COOKIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little more my speed. No one here is the slightest bit hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does everybody just...kinda, you know -- talk here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much. Someone leads -- tells their story. And then everyone else shares -- talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So since you're taking me here does that make you my sponsor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I don't think I could do                     * that. (off Kate's expression) `Cause, um... (nervously searches) ...well, it could get weird. But                   * I'll help you find one if you want. (gestures to the seats) We should sit down. Kate looks around the room at everyone taking their seats KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath; to Mr. Davies) I can't believe I'm really here. MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets better. Weirder, maybe -- but better.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The meeting has begun and everyone sits in a circle of chairs. Jenny is midway through her speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all I knew about taking care of myself was fucking people over and lying to get by. I had no idea how to even look for a normal job or pay my bills on time -- or pay my fucking bills at all. (beat) Now I pay my bills online. The group CHUCKLES. JENNY (CONT'D)                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I found a love in cooking. I've                * got my own catering business now.                  * And...maybe I just replaced alcohol with chocolate chips and cigarettes, but still...it's been years since I woke up in a park -- in a different state. LAUGHTER. Kate leans in towards Mr. Davies and whispers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sponsor potential? Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her number at break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like you're my wingman. Kate grins at Mr. Davies, who smiles shyly and glances aw

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: An older man -- ARLO -- stands and announces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlo, Alcoholic. There'll now be a ten minute break. Smoke em' if you got em. As some of the PEOPLE go outside -- -- Kate walks over to Jenny, who's getting a cup of coffe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I liked your speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. All that dumb shit happened so I'm glad that now it's at least entertaining. (beat) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. This is my first meeting. Or... first meeting where I'm not wasted. Jenny LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah -- I remember doing some of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know how this stuff works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...could I get your number? I mean, I may not need it, but... JENNY                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. I can help explain it to you -- and also, we can just talk. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Yeah. (beat) You've been sober since you were
Jenny nods. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems really young. JENNY                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have much of a choice -- I crashed my car into a nursing home. (beat) I think the break is just about over. This meeting is the kind where everyone can share. Sharing always helps me, so...if it's not too weird -- try introducing yourself and telling the group what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Everyone is sitting down and sharing. The woman (TINA) ne to Kate is finishing up. TINA                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...anyway, that's where I'm at today. Thanks for listening. Everyone looks at Kate. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, um...hello. I'm Kate and... (long beat) ...I'm an alcoholic? Kate nervously LAUGHS. GROUP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I don't mean to laugh -- it's just saying those words... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think I'm an alcoholic, but I don't really know. I drink -- a lot. I've always drank. Everyone I know drinks a lot. I never really thought I had a problem -- lately though it seems like maybe I do. I just want to be able to drink a beer without it turning into twenty -- or wetting my bed. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems like every time I drink something awful happens. All the shit that I used to laugh off isn't really funny anymore. The dumb drunk stuff has gone from embarrassing to scary. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kinda...scared. Kate stops. Looks around self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF short, quick scenes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits at her desk grading papers. Kate's hand has an uncontrollable tremble as she tries to carefully make red checks on students' papers. Self-consciously, she steadie her right hand with her left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate shovels chocolate chips from the bag into her mouth while driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is at a meeting -- talking to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT While Kate and Charlie eat dinner, Kate drinks WATER but focuses on Charlie's glass of WINE and the slow, careful he takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGH Charlie and Owen play video games and LAUGH while Kate tr to concentrate on a book -- but is clearly distracted by loud the guys are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Charlie sleeps on the other side of the bed as Kate write a notebook. Kate stops writing. She stares at Charlie as sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate rides her bicycle hard. It might even be...exercise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about ninety days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE is dressed differently, some people have differe hair-cuts, etc. Mr. Davies stands up, holding a PLASTIC CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone here who has ninety days of continuous sobriety? Kate stands up -- she looks way more "together" than she earlier. She gives Mr. Davies a hug -- and he hands her a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Kate. I'm an alcoholic. Everyone CLAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kate. Kate sits down next to Jenny and gives her a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate -- who eats a piece of CAKE -- sits on a patio with Jenny, Mr. Davies, and several other PEOPLE from AA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really proud of you, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda can't believe it's been ninety days. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The longest I've gone since high school without drinking was, like, a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first three months were such hell. I think I'm only sober today because I just never want to go through that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird -- in after-school specials the getting-sober part was only like a minute of the movie and suddenly...daddy's all okay. Several people LAUGH. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's so fucking hard and weird and suddenly I have all these other problems now that drinking isn't the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?                                  * KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything else. Work, my non- existent relationship with my mom... JENNY                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw her? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to remember) A year, at least. JENNY                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...maybe it's time. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. (beat) And then there's my marriage. I mean, Charlie's great. Really great, he's supportive, especially at first. It's strange, though. I feel like alcohol was the thing that connected us and now that I don't drink we lead these two very different lives. (beat) We haven't slept together in forever... (laughs) I haven't pissed myself in awhile, though. So that's good. JENNY                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes time. Kate gives an exasperated look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-stern cheerleader tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep working the steps. (glances at her watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's grab coffee tomorrow, okay? I should actually run you home now and come back. I need to start locking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could stick around and help you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could take you home. (off Kate's reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Davies pulls up to Kate's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ex-wife -- she doesn't drink -- well, not like us, but as soon as I got sober I started to change and she just...didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were married. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was married once -- (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in my other life. But I shouldn't be talking to you about this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're a dude we can't talk? I don't get that "men stick with men, women stick with women" stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you were sitting where I'm sitting you'd understand. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to tell me that you have a crush on me? MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, one of your students?            * Crush? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, crush. MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat) I kind of do, yes. I have a crush on you. I know that's wrong -- you're newly sober and married and I shouldn't be thinking about you like that. But yeah, I should put that out on the table. (beat) Honesty. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I think you're a really good guy. MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great -- good guys are the nerds that carry the pretty girls' books. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon... MR. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're beautiful. Kate smiles bashfully. MR. DAVIES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And smart, and sexy, and cool... Mr. Davies moves slightly closer to Kate. MR. DAVIES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know it's wrong, but -- in meetings I stare at your lips and your legs and all I can think about is fucking your moist pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate jumps back, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Kate's horrified expression)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, crap! I don't know why I just said that. I'm really, really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely sorry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that was a bad thing to say, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so, so sorry. I'm just confused, and I don't know how to talk to women --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus -- you can't just go around telling people you want to fuck their "moist pussy." (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who even says that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry. Kate gets out of the car, slams the door shut, then leans to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go inside my house -- where I live with my husband. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your creepy version of honesty. 45   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Kate lies in bed and appears slightly bored as -- -- Charlie is under the covers, going down on Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from under the covers) Yep -- I'm just pacing myself. The tortoise wins the race. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm not really in the mood. CHARLIE                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I wanted to give you a 90 days gift. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay -- the 90 days was the gift. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry if I was doing a bad job -- I'm kinda hammered. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. Charlie... (long beat) ...I miss you. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?                                                * Charlie comes up from under the covers -- and looks a bit tipsy. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean...I don't know. I don't really feel connected to you anymore. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I do something? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) We don't talk that much. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to talk, but now you come home and go to meetings and by the time you get back I'm -- KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna say "tired." Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some stuff I need to do this weekend. I think I'm gonna go up to Lake Arrowhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? To see your mom? Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) Do I need a reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your mom? Kinda. (beat) Is this the "amends" step?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then why're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) We send her checks. But we never actually see her. Sometimes it feels like I'm paying her to not be in my life. I thought it would be nice to visit her. (beat) And Jenny thinks it would be a good         * idea. Charlie LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...I mean, do you do everything your sponsor tells you to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Do you think I'm brainwashed or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...it's been a long damn time since you've seen your mom. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't listen when I suggested we visit her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly gets that it's an ego thing for Charlie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby -- I listen to you. This just...it felt like the right time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the changes I'm going through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can I come with you? It'll be like a little vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...I think I should go alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, if you do that you'll just get depressed. If I go we can try to make it fun. Go hiking and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you go, don't take this the wrong way but -- I'd like it if maybe you didn't drink. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just while we're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can handle not drinking for like a day. Kate smiles and snuggles up into Charlie's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie drive and listen to MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie are parked in front of a -- -- HOUSE. Small. A little run-down. Sort of a vague ski c look. There's some dirty lawn furniture in the front yard well as a DOZEN LAWN-GNOMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...the lawn-gnomes. I missed those guys. Kate playfully punches Charlie in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving to a lawn-gnome)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Holger! Kate LAUGHS. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...we gonna go in? Charlie glances at Kate and reads the anxiety on her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie walk to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsettled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've brought something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something, you know? Flowers, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Definitely not that. They get to the door. Charlie looks at Kate -- who seems she'd be okay if they ran back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conceding) Go on... Charlie KNOCKS. FEMALE VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'minute! KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Oh, God... The door opens, revealing -- -- ROCHELLE: late-50's, wears an old shredded heavy metal band T-shirt and tight ripped-up jeans, looks like she en an afternoon drink or three. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Katie! Rochelle wraps her arms around Kate. ROCHELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left you a message, mom. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know I don't check that thing. (notices Charlie; slightly flirty) Hello there, young man. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ms. Foster. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then... (beat) ...what a lovely surprise -- you two came to visit. Hell has frozen over. (laughs) Just kidding. Come inside -- let me fix you both some drinks. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just water for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rochelle LAUGHS as she leads the way. Kate glances at Cha -- she already seems slightly annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie sit down. The place is a MESS. Magazines and junkmail everywhere. T much furniture thrown together in a chaotic manner. The w are covered with framed HEAVY METAL BAND POSTERS -- and t are ASHTRAYS everywhere, filled to the brim with cigarett butts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you wouldn't believe how much the neighborhood's changed! After Mr. Baker passed away and the kids put Mrs. Baker in a home, the people that moved in, oof! Rochelle walks in holding a tray with THREE GIN AND TONIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like they don't even understand the concept of birth control in their country! Rochelle hands Charlie a glass and then goes to Kate and a drink on the table in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confides)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ask me, I think it's a meth house. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've always got those little five year old twins "playing" in the yard, but I'm pretty sure they're the lookouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty wild, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? (notices that Kate hasn't touched her drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, honey? Think I forgot how to mix `em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I just wanted water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
