dialogues.text: Oh, please! Where I'm from, "no" means "yes." (to Charlie) Am I right or am I right? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing it) Huh-huh... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's actually why I wanted to come up, mom. (beat) I stopped drinking. Rochelle LAUGHS -- then realizes Kate and Charlie aren't joking. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly serious) Are you telling me I'm going to be a grandma? Rochelle tears up with joy. ROCHELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- that's so exciting! I'm gonna be a grandma! (to Charlie) And you know that "no drinking when you're pregnant" thing is just a myth. I drank plenty when I was pregnant with Kate -- and look how she turned out! Beat. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not pregnant, mom. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just needed a break. I'm sober for the first time in years. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (dismissive) ...we'll see how long that lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a while, actually. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chimes in) 90 days. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) You've sure picked the right partner -- (gestures to Charlie) -- for this little mission. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) Hey -- I'm not drinking either...today. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlie; slightly annoyed) Drink if you want to, Charlie. (to Rochelle) Charlie didn't stop drinking. I'm doing it by myself. (beat) And...I started going to 12-step meetings. Rochelle looks slightly disgusted. ROCHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...yes. Assholes Anonymous. (to Charlie) Katie's father went to those meetings a few years after we got married. Dried up. Left me. You can see how well that worked out for me... (Rochelle gestures to her living room) ...I raised his daughter in this PALACE while he's somewhere in Florida with his shiny new wife and kids. (beat) Bastard. (long beat; to Charlie) You better be careful -- they change. Kate and Charlie exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be happy for me, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...I'm sorry -- I'm not being a good hostess, am I? Rochelle gets up, takes the drink away from Kate, and chu it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll microwave you your favorite.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Charlie, Kate, and Rochelle watch a REALITY TV SHOW -- wh eating... ...MCDONALDS CHEESEBURGERS. Rochelle rests her head on Kate's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I acted like a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, mom. I know you can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie wander around Santa's Village -- -- an abandoned Christmas-themed amusement park (with gia ginger bread houses, plastic Christmas trees, etc.) in th middle of the woods. Creepy and nostalgic at the same tim Looks like the set of a Christmas horror film. Kate holds Charlie's hand as she leads him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place shut down a decade ago and then there was a fire and now it's basically abandoned. Charlie seems totally impressed by the weirdness of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came here every year the week before Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I worked here in high school -- selling hot chocolate. And they had real reindeer, too. They kept `em over there. Kate points at the remains of a PEN. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom worked here when she was younger. I think everyone who grew                  * up around here worked at Santa's Village at some point. Charlie just nods and listens -- he's in awe of this plac KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I think of when I think of Christmas. (long beat) Thanks for coming up here with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry my mom's so awful. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) She just can't handle her liquor. Kate and Charlie look in each other's eyes. Seem to have moment. And then Charlie asks -- CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever hook up with guys when you worked here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- sneak off with a co- worker and do it against a pine tree or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if I were a teenage boy working with a stone cold fox like you I'd totally want to hook up with you here. Like...in the ginger bread house. Charlie puts his arms around Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were probably the coolest girl in town -- and the prettiest. I'm sure everyone was in love with you. Kate giggles. They kiss. It's sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks in to her class to find --

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: -- a GROUP OF TEACHERS -- including Principal Barnes and Davies -- standing in the room, which has been decked out a -- -- BABY SHOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't keep quiet. Sorry. I just had to tell everyone so we could celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...you shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to thank me -- just open your presents! Kate looks at her desk which is stacked with PRESENTS wra in pink and baby blue wrapping paper. There's also a CAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `C'mon, Kate! You're gonna love what I got you! Is it a boy or a girl?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Kate opens a present -- a MOBILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seems nauseous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's so...nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's to hang over the crib!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... MONTAGE: Kate opens presents while the teachers CLAP. Eventually, Kate begins to CRY -- which everyone assumes tears of joy. Principal Barnes takes a bite of cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm...it's so moist. Kate glances at Mr. Davies, who cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate! Kate looks back to see Mr. Davies running over -- but she doesn't reply or slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- I am so, so sorry. You have no idea how much this has been eating me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you said to me was really fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you even thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't -- I was just...I try to be really honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get that. But you can't force your "honesty" on everyone you know. Mr. Davies nods. He looks really embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing tone) I'm flattered that you have...feelings for me. I am. But I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry. I'll apologize to your husband if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- you don't have to do that. I didn't even tell him. But...you can't say that to a girl -- like, ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. Consider that a rule of thumb. (beat) Someday, you're gonna meet a nice, available lady -- but if you say "moist pussy" to her, you will never, ever, ever get to see that part of her body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even more embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like this was a really good talk. Kate forces a smile. 55   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Kate stares at a -- -- HALF-EATEN BIRTHDAY CAKE ("OWEN" is still sort of legi on the kitchen table. It's totally mutilated. She walks out the back door into the

dialogues.speaker: BACKYARD
dialogues.text: where she finds Charlie, Owen, and one of Owen's friends --

dialogues.speaker: -- GREG, 21 --
dialogues.text: -- listening to loud MUSIC while they play FOOSBALL. They're all SHIT-HOUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...getting married would fucking                     * suck. I can't even imagine waking                    * up to the same person for the rest                   * of my life.                                          * Kate walks out.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's up, Kate?                Hey, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you guys found the birthday                    * cake Jenny and I baked.                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks! You should get a                       * slice.                                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlie)                             * I, uh...kinda thought we'd all eat           * it together.                                 * CHARLIE                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby -- I didn't even think about            * that. I'm sorry.                             * OWEN                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really good.                          * GREG                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have plenty of tequila to make            * up for the cake.                             * OWEN                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's in AA -- so she can't drink.          * She hasn't drank in forever -- like          * thirty-eight days or some shit.              * KATE                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-five days, actually.                  * GREG                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucks! Do you still smoke               * weed?                                        * KATE                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I wasn't a big weed smoker               * anyway.                                      * OWEN                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smoked crack though, didn't              * you?                                         * Kate's face goes blank. She stares at Charlie.         * GREG                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit -- I hear crack gets you so             * high!                                        * CHARLIE                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- my wife doesn't smoke crack.           * Jesus...                                     * OWEN                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm joking around. I know              * Kate's not a crackhead or some               * shit.                                        * (to Kate)                                * It was just that one time, right?            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry; to Charlie)                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Charlie.                                        * Kate storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Owen)                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your birthday, man, so I'm not                     * gonna make a big deal out of this --                    * but you need to shut the fuck up                        * sometimes.                                              *

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 57   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM/BATHROOM -

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Charlie walks in to see Kate getting ready to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- I'm sorry. He's drunk...really drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not mad at him -- I'm mad at you! You said you wouldn't tell anyone about what I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...sorry. I...was drunk too when I told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you guys just go to the bar now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hanging here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they have near-beer, baby. It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like a lot of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Kate doesn't say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands at the BLACKBOARD -- teaching addition and subtraction to the class. A little girl -- ISABEL -- raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hannah -- shouldn't you be more fatter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause of the baby. My mom got real fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken off-guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well..."Shouldn't you be fatter?" is the correct way to ask that question. Kate goes back to the board -- clearly wanting to move on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, one day when you're very old and wise fourth graders, you'll learn about multiplication and -- ISABEL                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hannah -- Shouldn't you be more fat? All the students look at Kate. She's on the spot. Fluster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... Kate searches for something to say. Anything. But then sh blurts -- KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm not going to have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: OOOH
dialogues.text: Kate immediately looks like she wishes she could take it back. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See -- I was pregnant but, it wasn't my time, I suppose... Another little girl -- WINNIE -- jumps in. WINNIE                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hannah -- did you kill the baby? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT? No -- of course not! WINNIE                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause my mom says that when you kill a baby you go to hell and you can't even go to church to ask god for forgiveness. The students begin to WHISPER to each other. Another boy -- TOBY -- asks -- TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hannah -- are you going to hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I didn't kill my baby! Okay, listen kids -- we shouldn't be talking about this. But... (beat) ...sometimes women get pregnant and then early on -- before it's even a baby -- they stop being pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because a doctor murders it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- not because a doctor   murdered it. (beat) It's called a miscarriage.   That means it wasn't my plan --   it's just what happened. (composes herself) Does anyone want to ask me   any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class nods but seems silently freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get back to subtraction -- or addition. Or both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits with Mr. Davies eating lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was bound to happen at some point. Kids notice things like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I had no idea how pro-life little Winnie Reddy is.                        * (beat) Remind me to wear my "May the fetus you save be gay" T-shirt to the next banana split night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate half-laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just think: the kids got a lesson about life and death that nobody planned on. I mean, you're years ahead of the standard curriculum for, uh, third graders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it matter that I lied? That I was never pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to answer that as a friend or as someone who takes the twelve steps very seriously? Kate shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the good thing is that it's all over now. Principal Barnes will think you're a martyr for losing a baby. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids won't ask about it anymore and as long as you don't toss your cookies again you won't have to deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied. To your boss -- and a bunch of small children. Who trust you. And rely on you to help them differentiate right from wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all, huh? 60   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM/DINING

dialogues.speaker: ROOM/KITCHEN/BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie eat TAKE-OUT FOOD in SILENCE. Kate texts her CELL PHONE -- not even paying attention to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I gotta say -- this is the boringest meal I've had in about as long as I can remember. Kate doesn't look up. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who're you texting? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still looking down) Jenny.                                      * CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's like a parole officer. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my sponsor. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad to know every little fuck- up I have is gonna become a topic of conversation with some chick I don't even know. Kate finishes her text. Puts down her phone. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fake enthusiasm) So...what'd you do today, honey? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished some writing and met up with Owen to watch the game and toss a few back. Dear. (beat) You do anything special? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied to my class again. I told them that I had a miscarriage. Charlie LAUGHS. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not funny. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. Telling kids fucked-up stuff is totally funny...in, you know -- a kinda fucked-up way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, well -- I'm glad I'm not actually having a baby. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Kate -- come on. What else were you supposed to do? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I feel like a piece of shit for lying. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that big a deal. Jesus. Is this what those meetings teach you? To make drama out of nothing? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not nothing. I lied to little kids and to my boss because I can't take responsibility for my actions. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go and tell the Principal that you were never pregnant? That the reason you puked is because you smoked crack all night? Would you feel better about yourself then? Beat. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about doing that, actually. (thinks about it) Yeah. I think I would feel better about myself. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Do it, then. I guess you don't need a job. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be like you -- I could stay home drinking all day and never do anything responsible. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) I never do anything responsible? What about buying this house that we live in? Or the food that we're eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having rich parents doesn't make you responsible. I think it's pretty much done the opposite. Charlie looks stunned.                                 * CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry that I have a family that supports us -- and not the other way around. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that supposed to mean? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Kate. But you can't be mad at me because my family has helped us out. You should be grateful we don't have to struggle. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't care if we struggled with money. I've struggled with money my whole life. (beat) I'd rather worry about where my next meal is coming from than if I - - in some drunken stupor -- married a man who just wants to party and meet bands. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about you being a baby. A selfish baby. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucking hate AA! It turned you into a bitch. A brain-washed bitch. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I'm not drunk all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you don't drink booze for three months and suddenly you're some saint? You have it all together and I'm just a baby? Kate doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, Kate. I'm trying to understand you. But it's hard. You're different and maybe it's good that you're different. Maybe I'm bad and bad for you or something -- because I didn't think the person you were before was so awful. I loved that person. Yeah, she drank a lot and she did some silly things...but she was my Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loved that person? Do you not love me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. But it's different. You're different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I was a mess. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm finally getting my life together -- and you loved me more before? Charlie looks at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda, yeah. Charlie looks like he immediately regrets what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate follows Jenny from her patio to her kitchen as she cleans up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so fucking weird right now -- Charlie doesn't love me like he used to and I've lied to my students multiple times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't feel...normal right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not normal. (beat) None of us are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything in life isn't connected to being an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not just talking about alcoholics. (beat) People are fucking weird. We all have a lot of shit we carry around in our heads that doesn't make sense. (beat) At least alcoholics have tools to work through it.                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Steps"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, steps -- and talking and listening and crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the crying part covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? I think my first year I cried tears I'd been saving since I was eight. (beat) It's hard to live your life...honestly. You know? Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea what you're gonna do about your school situation? What you're gonna say? Kate shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm gonna do about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...you wanna stay in my guest                     * room tonight? You can watch movies, get some good sleep...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure that's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. That's why I spent money on a guest bed -- so people could sleep in it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it might feel like it, but really, you don't have to figure everything out tonight. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate goes into her classroom and finds a NOTE on the desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Barnes hugs Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Kate. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't told many people this, but when I was young -- younger than you...I lost a child too. Kate's stunned. Looks like she feels terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It was a long, long time ago. Still hurts sometimes. But eventually...you move on. You have to. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat. Kate sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL BARNES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a phone call from a very upset parent. That's how I found out about...you know. Frankly, I'm not sure why you didn't feel like you could tell me. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I freaked out -- a student asked why I wasn't fat and I just froze up and then another student was saying I killed my baby and I didn't know what to do. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not angry with you -- but I need to be clear that this doesn't happen again. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't. I promise that. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By "not happening again," I mean that you don't discuss any controversial topics -- things the school board deems "family matters" with your class. (beat) No sex. No god. No drugs and alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I... Kate straightens up in her seat, takes a deep breath. She seems...exhausted. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I can't keep doing this. I feel awful. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) I know this all must be hard for you -- KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't understand. (beat) I have to be honest with you. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Barnes...I wasn't ever pregnant. Principal Barnes looks shocked. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied -- to the class and to you -- because I was scared. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...you vomited in class. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And when that happened I didn't know what to do because the truth is -- PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god -- are you really ill? Is it cancer? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, well, yes. I have a disease, but, um... (beat) ...it's alcoholism. Principal Barnes goes from concerned -- to angry. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working on it. I'm one- hundred days sober. When that happened I'd been out drinking and was hung over and -- PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vomited in front of children because you were hung over? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lied, saying that you were pregnant? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a student asked if I was pregnant -- and "yes" just kind of fell out of my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Barnes looks disgusted. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sick, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think you understand how wrong that is. To lie to me -- to the children. You know I felt so terrible for you when I found out that you had a mis -- ? (beat) -- how can you play with people's emotions like that? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sick. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...you told us you had a miscarriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threw you a baby shower. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry. I am. I've been wanting to tell you the truth because honesty has become really important to me. I'm in AA now and doing the steps and working with a sponsor and everything. (beat) It's really hard. I mean, I think my husband might hate me, and -- PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but what you did is totally irresponsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I can't have you here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Am I being fired? PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no -- the state wouldn't allow that without a report. I'm not going to write a report. Because, frankly, I have no idea what that report would say. (beat) But I'm forcing you to take a leave of absence and I think it's in your best interest if you find a job elsewhere. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- I'm really sorry, but I'm doing the right things now. PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you -- or I want to. I really do. But honey -- I believed you before. (beat) I'll have a sub take over your class starting tomorrow. It's late enough in the year that we can just say you're having personal problems
Principal Barnes looks at Kate. PRINCIPAL BARNES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- which seems to be the truth. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Barnes -- PRINCIPAL BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another word. I'm upset right now -- very upset -- and I think I'm doing you a favor by not reporting you. Kate struggles to say something, to try to explain hersel but no words come out until she musters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Kate stands, defeated, and leaves the Principal's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate glumly marches down the stairs -- holding a BOX fill with some of her things (including the BABY SHOWER GIFTS) Mr. Davies stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate -- what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Principal Barnes about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Everything? Did you tell her about...? Mr. Davies gestures to Kate's crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? (gets it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- no. I told her that I'm an alcoholic. And that I lied. And she fired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... (but concerned, too)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my god, Kate -- I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been going to AA and trying to be sober and this is what it got me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fired, for telling the truth. Mr. Davies awkwardly puts his arm around Kate's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I wish there was something I could do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a fuck-up. I'll always be a fuck up. I'm just like my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no -- you're a wonderful, smart woman Kate. You can't let this get you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Mr. Davies takes Kate's box of things from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me walk you to your car. Kate throws her arms around Mr. Davies and begins to -- -- full-on SOB. Mr. Davies seems flustered and a little scared but tries comfort Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate cries as she drives. She glances in the backseat at -- -- all the baby shower gifts -- -- and sobs even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks into a near-empty, depressing dive. She nervou sits at the bar. The BARTENDER -- a gruff looking guy with the sleeves rol up -- approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiskey. Double. The bartender gives Kate her drink. Kate immediately down it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have another one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure -- you gotta pay for the first one, though. Eight bucks. Kate puts a TWENTY DOLLAR BILL down. The bartender pours her another shot.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Kate has clearly been drinking for awhile -- she's curled at the bar, nursing her BEER. BARTENDER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miss -- I don't wanna be a downer or anything `cause I take it you've had a bad day, but um... I think you need to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you're pretty drunk -- and it's four p.m. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? Kate points to an old CRUSTY MAN at the other end of the KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not kicking him out. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to be a pal. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it -- you aren't my pal. I just got fired, and I just quit AA. (beat) It didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I was fine -- had a husband that loved me and maybe I sometimes did embarrassing stuff, but it was a phase. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go to AA and sober my husband and I start fighting and stop fucking -- and sober I get fired! Isn't that what's supposed to not happen? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, okay, well...I'm real sorry. But this place gets a little nuts after sundown and I don't think a pretty girl who just left AA should be here. (beat) I'm gonna call you a cab. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I don't want a cab. I want -- (glances around) -- drugs. Can you hook me up? The bartender rolls his eyes. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...let's go out back and smoke some crack. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, you're done. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm above smoking crack? `Cause I'm not. And are you really gonna tell me you're not a little attracted to me...? Kate leans across the bar, trying to look "seductive" -- she just looks like she might fall off her bar stool. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a teensy bit...? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the slightest. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...you might want to consider investing in glasses, buddy. `Cause I'm a...a stone cold fox. And I'm smart. And I'm... Kate begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a good person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time for you to go home. Now are you gonna let me call a cab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I'm not. I've got friends. They'll pick me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call Mr. Davies. He has dreams about me. The bartender takes a long look at Kate -- as though he's trying to size up if she's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope that works out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe my luck. I just want to get drunk and a bartender won't let me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is stupid. Kate stands up -- almost falling over -- and glares at th bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? Life is FUCKING

dialogues.speaker: STUPID
dialogues.text: Kate goes over to the old man at the end of bar, winks at him, then picks up his drink and chugs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is slumped in the back seat. In the front seat is Mr. Davies and Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey-wavey...I called you. Why'd you bring her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're worried about you, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accusing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parole officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your sponsor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay. You stumbled. You'll get back up. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout we drive to Mexico and party our asses off? My treat. Jenny and Dave glance back at Kate -- -- whose face reveals what a bad state she's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds fucking stupendous, right? 68   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - DAY Kate gets out of the car. Mr. Davies and Jenny watch with concerned expressions as -- Kate stumbles to her front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate! Are you sure you're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. 69   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING

dialogues.speaker: ROOM/KITCHEN/HALLWAY/BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Charlie plays a VIDEO GAME -- with the TV hooked up throu his STEREO SPEAKERS. Kate opens the doors and walks in, wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Babe -- you gotta hear this with the speakers hooked up. It's insane. Kate says nothing. Just stares at Charlie. Charlie looks up -- and is surprised to see Kate clearly drunk. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...what happened to you? Charlie stops playing the game. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm drunk. I'm fired from my job. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got any drinks? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...we have soda. I can make coffee. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be cute with me. You know what I mean. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...I guess you aren't doing the AA thing anymore? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gave that away? Kate turns and goes to the kitchen -- -- reappearing a moment later with a BOTTLE OF TEQUILA, s and limes. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby -- let's do some shots. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm celebrating. What the fuck does it look like? Kate takes a shot. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna be a little girl or are you gonna drink with me? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the right thing to do here is. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so let me see if this makes sense: you say you miss the old Kate -- the Kate who drinks and blacks out and has fun. (beat) Well...here she is. Kate smiles -- but she looks more desperate and drunk tha fun. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I didn't mean that. I was just being a jerk. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah you were. And what? Now you won't drink with me? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Having a beer or something is one thing, but...I think you really may have a problem. Kate LAUGHS. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thanks for all the support when I was trying to be sober! Kate takes another shot. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't realize -- KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you didn't realize! You don't fucking care about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! Of course I care about you. I love you. Kate takes a shot and approaches Charlie. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. Love is the easy part. It's the rest of the shit that's hard. Kate kisses Charlie. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your pants. Charlie gently pushes Kate away. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I think you should get to sleep. You're really wasted. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna sleep. I wanna fuck. Kate pulls Charlie -- who struggles -- down to the couch...and straddles him. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, will you stop? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I want you to fuck me! Charlie calmly tries to move Kate off of him. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. This is weird. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a man and fuck your wife! Charlie -- who's creeped out now -- forcefully pushes Kat off. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Jesus -- what the fuck is wrong with you? Kate has become quite angry and belligerent by this point and begins picking up HOUSEHOLD OBJECTS and throwing them Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With me? With me?! What the fuck is wrong with me? I try hard and I get shit on! Fucked up family, fired from my job -- this marriage. Nothing's wrong with me! What's wrong with YOU?! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, you need to -- KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What? What do I need? I can't drink because I'm crazy or something and I can't stay sober because of you! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're blaming other people for your problems. Kate picks the tequila bottle back up, takes a sip, then -- runs at Charlie and tackles him to the ground. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! You're acting like a freak! Kate rips Charlie's SHIRT -- -- and holds the bottle over his head while straddling hi as if she's about to hit him with it. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! What's wrong with you? Kate holds the bottle in the air and looks hard at Charli She begins to weep. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be sober and be with you. Kate gets a flash of anger again and just as it seems lik she's about to hit Charlie with the bottle, she -- -- upturns the bottle and begins to chug the tequila. Charlie tries to yank the bottle away, but Kate holds on tight. With the bottle at Kate's lips -- and tequila pour down her chin -- the couple wrestles for control of the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate wears a UNIFORM and carefully works on a CAKE. On the other side of the kitchen, Jenny makes APPETIZERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me. Jenny walks over and tries the icing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods with approval)                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A middle-aged MAN stands at a podium in front of a medium sized group of PEOPLE -- about twenty-five or so, includi Kate, Jenny, and Mr. Davies -- and says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this meeting we give cakes to celebrate sober birthdays. We have one birthday tonight -- for Kate, for one year. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and Dave are giving her the cake. Kate hugs everyone -- then blows out ONE CANDLE on a CAKE before standing at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm Kate, alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard that your best day drinking is worse than your worst day sober. (beat) Well...that is SO not true! I had amazing times drinking, dancing, and laughing...feeling like the most adorable, charming girl in the world. And I was adorable. (beat) I'd piss my pants, but I was still cute. People in the crowd LAUGH a little bit. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I first tried getting sober, I figured that as long as I didn't drink...everything else would just magically work out. But it didn't. (beat) My marriage fell apart. I got fired from my job. And that shit happened SOBER! I never read that in any pamphlet... (shakes her head) ...that isn't what I signed up for. (beat) Um...so, I relapsed. Another shitty slogan I've heard in the rooms is that when you're sober for a bit and drink again "the disease waits for you, picks up where it left off." (beat) I'm sorry you guys, but I HATE those slogans. They all sound like bumper stickers. But, I have to admit...for me, that last one is pretty damn true. (beat) When I drink...I become another person. And that person is a pretty big asshole. Well, unless you want to give me drugs or buy me drinks -- then that person is awesome. People knowingly LAUGH. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't happy being the "good-time girl," though. And honestly, I wasn't very good at it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is really different than it was a year ago. I live alone. I'm bored a lot more. I have a job that pays a lot less. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thankful for the program -- for my friends in here who took the time to help me and give a shit about me. Kate glances at Jenny and Mr. Davies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are people that used to be a part of my life that I miss -- a lot -- but... (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm really grateful for this boring new life of mine. Kate smiles and steps down from the podium as people CLAP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, Owen, and a woman -- MILLIE -- stand at the bar, drinking BEER and WHISKEY SHOTS. Owen speaks -- but Milli seems way more into Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in North Carolina for a while                     * -- Durham -- playing minor league ball. I had some real heat. That's when I met Crash, here. (gestures to Charlie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd been sent down to single-A to teach me how to carry myself as a pro ball-player. We got involved with the same woman -- an older chick -- but Crash won her in the end. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really taught me some...important life-lessons. Millie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...that's a pretty crazy way to meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are sorta like that movie...what's it called? OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plays dumb) I don't know. Which one? (to Charlie) Do you know what movie she means? Charlie -- who's pretty hammered -- shakes his head. MILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bull"...something? What is it? Charlie and Owen feign ignorance. MILLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. It'll come to me. (to Charlie; flirty) So...what do you do now, Crash? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I write about music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Owen gestures to a WAITRESS to bring THREE MORE SHOTS. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I do freelance for a lot of magazines. But print really is dead. So now most of my stuff winds up on websites. Which is depressing. `Cause you can't hold it -- you can just look at it. It's like... Charlie seems lost in drunken thought. Long, awkward sile Millie puts her hand on Charlie's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? MILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking about writing for websites and you kinda trailed off, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to save the situation) So, Crash -- why don't you tell this nice lady about the 21 days you were up in "The Show," and what the crowds were like, and -- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was crazy. I... Charlie drifts off for a moment. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Millie) I'm sorry -- I'm sure you're a great lady. You have lovely hands and hair but... Charlie begins to walk away, wobbly on his feet. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm gonna go to the...I'm just gonna go. Charlie stumbles off. MILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Charlie leaves) You want a ride...? Charlie exits the bar. MILLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Owen) Um...is he cool to drive? OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he'll be fine -- on his bicycle. MILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rides a bicycle? OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah -- (smiles) -- as a teenager, he was a bike racing champion growing up in Bloomington, Indiana. He and his friends were called the "Cutters" -- and they beat a bunch of rich college kids in this big race. It was great. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back then, I was a kickboxing instructor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie rides his BICYCLE down the street. Swerving all o the place, he's obviously drunk. Red and Blue LIGHTS flash behind him. Charlie turns to se -- a POLICE OFFICER. 74   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Charlie leaves Kate a VOICEMAIL MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone; seems sort of nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I got into a little trouble -- drunk in public. On a bicycle. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I was thinking...maybe I need to go to one of those meetings. I'd like to go with you, though. If that's cool. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know if we could discuss it sometime, okay? Maybe you could come over to our -- um, my house? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah. Thanks. Charlie hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Let me know if we could discuss it sometime?" (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such an idiot... 75   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - STREET/FRONT YARD Kate and Charlie stand by Kate's car, which is parked in front by the street. She's just arrived. Awkward tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss our house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...yeah. Sometimes. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Miss me? Beat. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. (long beat) I've been sober for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kate reaches into her purse and takes out her ONE YEAR CH showing it to Charlie. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave you that? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. A couple of days ago. Tuesday. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...wow. Congratulations. That's really...really...just great. I mean it. (beat) Tuesday is the night I got pulled over. (laughs) Parallel lives, huh? Kate rolls her eyes. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- you dating anyone? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Charlie seems relieved. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either. Owen keeps trying to get me to be his "wing-man" and it's ridiculous and these girls in bars are so lame and I just keep thinking how I wish I was meeting you in a bar for the first time and I didn't come with any baggage and I could buy you a drink and flirt with you all night and ask for your number. (beat) Wanna go out sometime? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's a good idea. Charlie nods. Long beat. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up, didn't I? Kate looks down, doesn't speak. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. I know I did. I had a beautiful woman who used to love me and now when I see her she doesn't even want to look me in the eyes. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, please don't do this. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. I miss the way you taste and smell and...I miss things about you that used to drive me nuts! I miss you liking shitty 80's music and fake punk-rock from the 90's... KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like shitty 80's music. (beat) I like good 80's music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and all I want to do is touch you one more time to just, remember -- to make sure it was real. Silence. Kate looks Charlie in the eyes and gives him a slight smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing course)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or...maybe I'm a just a delusional fucking idiot. 76   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM/KITCHE Kate and Charlie walk in -- it looks sort of the same, bu number of items are missing, and it's messier. In general the room looks more "dude."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look really thin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you last eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno -- like...I'm not sure. (seems slightly concerned                           * that he can't remember)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we order something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, yeah -- or I could make a bacon and egg sandwich...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I haven't really been doing the meat thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. It starts with alcohol. Then meat. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you given up fun, too? Kate looks at Charlie -- he's half-smiling, not sure if s finds him funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Bad joke. Kate cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Bacon and egg sandwiches. But I'm gonna make them. Charlie raises his eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Kate's at the stove, cooking bacon and eggs. Charlie goes to the FRIDGE and gets a BOTTLE OF BEER. Kate glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Charlie puts the beer back in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you drink a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Kate stands by the stove and watches as -- -- Charlie -- who sits at the kitchen table -- wolfs down bacon and egg sandwich. Kate seems pleased that Charlie enjoys it so much. 77   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BACKYARD - TWILIGH Kate and Charlie play croquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look a little tired -- like they've been playing a while. Kate seems to be much better than Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been playing a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't played in over a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how're you beating me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Innate talent? They keep playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't met anyone even vaguely interesting since we separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...stick to the game, okay? Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been masturbating like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Fine. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding your bike -- drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I wasn't. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But is that really the point? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are trying to say? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I worry about you. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah, I can understand that. I used to worry about you. But now I know you're okay. (beat) That makes me happy...I mean, it fucking sucks that you're better off without me but I'm glad you're doing well. No reply from Kate. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you move back in if I came to meetings? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go for yourself, not to make me happy. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, would you? KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not moving back in. That wasn't the response Charlie wanted to hear. KATE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I should go. It's gonna get dark soon. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can always turn the lights on. KATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, would you at least...let me take you out on a date? Kate says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...? Kate shakes her head. Charlie seems hurt -- but still determined. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...fine. 0 for 2. (new direction) Last question: can we just...play one more game? Kate doesn't answer. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...you keep kicking my ass. It's embarrassing. You've gotta give me a chance to redeem myself. (soft) Please. Kate thinks about it for a long beat, and doesn't say yes ...but she also doesn't say no. There's a look of hope in Charlie's eyes.
